decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from 19 September 2023.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [0588-100.01-Rev. C, 0588-100.02-Rev. B, 0588-100.03-Rev. C, 0588-100.04-Rev. C, 0588-100.05-Rev. C, 0588-100.07-Rev. B, 0588- 100.12-Rev. F, 0588-300.01-Rev. B, 0588-300.02-Rev. C, 0588-300.03-Rev. B, 0588-300.04-Rev. C, 0588-300.05- Rev. B, 0588-300.06-Rev. C, 0588-400.02-Rev. C, 0588-400.03-Rev. B, Design & Access Statement and Planning Statement, Heritage Impact Assessment, Photo Schedule, Construction Method Statement, 23.159.TW1, 23.159.TW2, 23.159.TW3, 23.159.01, 23.159.02, 23.159.03, 23.159.04, 23.159.05, 23.159.06, 23.159.07, Fire Safety Statement, Flood Risk Assessment, Arboricultural Impact Assessment, OS 2313-22.2, Letter from Graeme Drummond dated 15th June 2022, Letter to Hounslow Highways dated 20th June 2022 and Letter from Hounslow Highways dated 28th June 2022. Received: 25/7/2023, OS 2313-22.3. Received: 26/7/2023 
0588-500.01, 0588-500.02, Documents for Prunus avium and Acer campestre. Received: 30/8/2023
BR1-100.08, BR1-100.09, BR1-100.10, BR1-300.08 Proposed Street Elevation, BR1-300.08 Proposed East Elevation, BR1-300.09, BR1-300.11, BR1-300.12, BR1-300.13, BR1-400.04, BR1-400.05, BR-500.01 and Unnumbered Photographs. Received: 30/4/2024
Covering Letter. Received: 14/6/2024].

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.
Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - The basement hereby permitted shall at no time be used or occupied as a separate dwelling independent of the main house and shall not be used as sleeping accommodation.
Reason: In order to ensure that adequate living standards are maintained and to protect neighbours' living conditions.

Condition : 5 - The trees that are specified on the drawings hereby approved to be retained shall be protected before commencement of any works on site and throughout the course of the development by methods that conform to the best practice guidance contained in British Standard BS5837: 2012 or any guidance that shall have superseded it

Reason: In order to ensure a satisfactory appearance of the site and the area and to promote biodiversity.

Condition : 6 - No development shall be carried out until such time as the person carrying out the work is a member of the Considerate Constructors Scheme and its code of practice, and the details of the membership and contact details are clearly displayed on the site so that they can be easily read by members of the public. 
Reason: In order to protect the living conditions of neighbouring residents.
description: Variation of Condition 2 (Approved plans) to make basement deeper and with internal alterations, submitted pursuant planning permission 00177/8/P6 dated 19/09/2023 for Demolition of existing single storey rear extension and outbuildings. Erection of a single storey rear extension, first floor rear extension, two storey side extension, full basement with lightwells, internal alterations and associated tree works, soft and hard landscaping, refuse and recycling store and bike store.
